title: Checking my routing to LoL servers due to high ping
body:
Good afternoon, 

I am looking for the best way to check the routing my ISP is using to get from my house to the LoL servers as my ping keeps slowly increasing it seems as time passes since the server move.  When the servers were moved to Chicago my ping doubled but I made the best I could of it.  Slowly over the months since it has now tripled from what it was and in some cases is 4x higher :(  

When I play from work my ping is pretty stable and about 50-60ms which is perfect but home I am sitting at anywhere from 80-120 and it seemingly changes from day to day :( 

My work is probably routing me through the east coast as all our traffic seems to go that way ( even our work computers think were in Toronto ) even though were in BC.  

Options to test this? I assume that Shaw is just using a crap route from my house to the Chicago DC's.

replies.body: Haro ? Any update from Riot's point of view.

He'll next send you to check their net logs, run their software that'll help you (it wont), cycle your modem+router and if nothing changes to call your ISP.
Afterall this is clearly your fault not Riots.

Hello Targons Blade, 

Thank you for the assistance.  Hopes this can help shed some insight.

One of the bet ways to look into your routing is to run a complete traceroute to the test server IP we set up. I recommend using [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) and running a traceroute for 5 minutes with the IP address 192.64.170.1

After it has run for 5 minutes, you can export the results as Text. Feel free to post the results here if you'd like me to take a look and point out where the issues are.
